conclusion: To predict which container the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, let's analyze each step of the flow.
Each color starts from a different point at the top: A (cyan), B (yellow), C (blue), and D (light cyan).
The black, yellow, white, and grey baffles will influence the direction of the liquids.
Cyan from A flows towards the black baffle and moves downward.
Yellow from B flows onto the yellow baffle, directing it diagonally downward.
Blue from C moves directly down along the yellow baffle.
Light cyan from D moves straight down, slightly deflected by the grey baffle.
The yellow and blue liquids merge and are directed downward by the grey baffle.
The light cyan from D continues downward, influenced by the grey baffle to the right.
Cyan from A flows into container E.
Yellow and blue mixture flows into container F.
Light cyan from D flows into container G.
The liquids will flow into containers E, F, and G as follows: E: Cyan from A, F: Yellow from B and Blue from C, G: Light cyan from D.
